item.title: The Languag of Chinese Herbal Medicine
item.description: Chinese Medicine consists of five branches: Herbs, Acupuncture, Tui Na (massage), Qi Gong (movement and meditation) and Food Therapy, the first three being regularly practiced in a clinical setting. In China, and other countries around the world, they are different tracks, and practitioners and students focus on one only. Among them, Herbs are considered the most difficult to master, primarily due to the volume of information which must be memorized.
